Cons: I paid $8.30 for three day shipping but it took five days for me to get it. I think its unfair to have to pay for a service I did not recieve. I think you should offer a standard shipping for people especially if it takes the standard to get your purchase anyways. I was very disappointed with the dilervery.
Pros: My kodak c813 was in great shape when I got it today.

Title: Nice Camera
Cons: Mine didn't come with a strap, probably just mine but it is still a con. LCD display could be better.
Pros: I have to have a time/date stamp for my job. Zoom works very well.
Comments: I use this for business and play. I do scrapbooking and all the pictures come out looking great for that. I recently went to a renaissance faire. I used the zoom for the jousting event and got some great picture. It does an amazing job at taking motion pictures on max zoom. It also works very well for my business in which I have to take pictures of foreclosed houses and represent the amount of damage the house is in need of to the bank who now owns them. For the price I think it is a steal, keep in mind you arn't going to get all the bells and whistle with a below the 100 dollar mark camera. Still one of the best cameras you can get in my opinion if you can't or don't want to spend the extra money.

Title: Do not buy
Cons: Bad design. As you will read in other reviews, this model is prone to dying very short in it's life.
Pros: 8Mp
Comments:
Like many others I only had the chance to use this camera once really, after that is sat on my desk for some time. When I picked it up again it wouldn't turn on, so naturally I replaced the batteries but to no avail. After trying about 4 sets of other batteries I still can't get the camera to turn on. It was dead within a few months of first use. It was never bumped, dropped or had liquid spilled on it.

I'm not as disappointed as some though since I didn't buy the camera, I won it in a raffle. Of course, since I won it in a raffle, I don't have the receipt and am unable to get it repaired under warranty. Easy come easy go I suppose.

Title: good camera for the price
Cons: Like my other kodak cameras this one is battery hungry, so I don't leave the batteries in it because it will drain them down. Not a big deal though resetting the date and time each time I use it.
Pros: very good camera for the price. Works well in video mode basically making a cheap camcorder out of it. I own a 2 MP and 5 MP Kodak already and also a Panasonic 7 MP. Out of those I've always preferred kodak as the color correction on photos has always appeared better to me and this camera lives up to that.
Comments: My only wish is that it had a 10X optical zoom, but is an exceptinal cam for the price. I don't think you'll be disappointed.

Title: Pretty good point-and-shoot
Cons:
The video is in quicktime format, not my favorite format. Sorta a hassle to convert the video format every time to upload it to sites like facebook or youtube. Plus there's a lack of customization (no aperture/shutter speed option in the menu) and the F-number can only go from F2.7 to F4.8, not ideal for landscape photography. Also the auto-focusing can get annoying as it usually focuses in on something I don't want it in focus.
Yes it lacks those things but seriously..for $70 you can't complain.
Pros: Yeah this is a pretty good Point and shoot camera. If you're looking for a camera for family photos or something to carry around and you don't care for 'professional looking pictures' then this is a pretty good camera. I really never had any problems that some of the others were talking about. Battery life seems pretty good, quality is good (dropped it a bunch of time, turns on every time) and the pictures come out pretty good too.
Comments: I'm starting to grow out of this camera and am currently looking at a DSLR camera but if you just "em myspace pics" and you don't care for any professional-looking pictures, then this camera is definitely for you.  You won't go broke getting it, takes good portrait and macro shots, and it fits in your pocket.

Title: Kodak easyshare
Cons: none so far
Pros: works great. was bought as a Christmas gift for my teenage daughter and has worked flawlessly
Comments: bought with combo package deal  had case & 2gb mini disk with it.

Title: NICE BUDGET CAMERA
Cons: LACK OF OPTICAL STABILIZATION. THIS CAMERA HAS DIGITAL PICTURE STABILIZATION.
Pros: NICE 12BUDGET CAMERA @$ 69.99 WITH FREE SHIPPING AND NICE ITEM TO GIFT SOMEONE. EASY MENU BETTER PICTURE QUALITY. I HAVE USED SEVERAL KODAK CAMERA, LIKE Z 650 Z612 C743 C613 C633 & I HAVE GIFTED ALL CAMERA EXCEPT Z 612. AS PER PRICE FEATURES ARE NICE. THIS CAMERA USE AA BATTERIES THAT IS PLUS POINT. ONE CAN NOT RUN WITHOUT BATTERIES. AND AA BATTERY LIKE ENERGIZER OR DURACELL RUN OVER 100 PHOTOES
Comments: KODAK SHOULD GIVE AV CABLE FOR THIS CAMERA . KODAK SUPPLY ONLY USB CABLE TO CONNECT TO COMPUTER AND IF YOU WANT TO SEE PHOTOS OR VIDEO ON TV IT IS NOT POSSIBLE. I WONDER WHETHER COMPATIBLE AV CABLE IS AVAILABLE OR NOT. I TRIED TO CONNECT AV CABLE OF KODAK Z 612 TO THIS CAMERA BUT IT DOSE NOT WORK.

Title: Dont buy
Cons: Turns on "when it feels like it"
Pros: Small...thats it.
Comments: DONT BUY !

Title: PERFECT
Cons: Wish I would have bought sooner!
Pros: This is neat! I'm not a shutter bug so thats the low knowledge. But you don't have to know anything.

Pros: Excellent camera, crisp clear view screen takes exellent pictures. bought for my mother for christmas and she loves it. shes still trying out all the bazillion features it has. easy to use. images on the screen are legible.
Comments: Should have bought one for myself :)
